Image 6 of 23 The revamped AT&T Center is not set to open until Oct. 18 but thanks to Spurs.com, the city has been given a sneak peek into the $100 million project that has kept hundreds of workers busy throughout the summer.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The revamped AT&T Center is not set to open until Oct. 18 but... Image 7 of 23 When the basketball season tips off on October, fans will enjoy an entirely new experience, judging from a gallery of photos posted on the team’s website showing an unrecognizable interior of the venue.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk When the basketball season tips off on October, fans will enjoy an... Image 8 of 23 During the Bexar County Commissioner’s Court on Sept. 1, Economic Development Manager Melissa Shannon disclosed a third of the budget has been spent on the renovations.

Image 9 of 23 The pictures show what the funds have been spent on, though it’s not all installed yet. When the new AT&T Center does reopen, it will be lit be millions of LED lights and new video boards displaying on-court action to every corner of the house, even to fans seated in the lower level area via underbelly scoreboard screens, Spurs.com reported.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The pictures show what the funds have been spent on, though it’s... Image 10 of 23 The report said Musco Lighting Systems will be implemented in the center – the same company that illuminates the Statue of Liberty.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The report said Musco Lighting Systems will be implemented in the... Image 11 of 23 The Fan Shop will also get a facelift and the Charter Level will have more space for new concessions and bars.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The Fan Shop will also get a facelift and the Charter Level will... Image 12 of 23 On the topic of dining, the stadium’s Whataburger will have a dine-in experience and a public entrance to be used during non-event hours, according to Spurs.com.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk On the topic of dining, the stadium’s Whataburger will have a... Image 13 of 23 The suite life will be sweeter with 14 new theater boxes “that create a new intimate entertainment experience,” according to the site.
Photo: Provided By Spurs.com/Katie Funk The suite life will be sweeter with 14 new theater boxes “that... There will be more room for concessions and bar space on the... Image 23 of 23 More leaked photos of AT&T Center renovations surface online from San Antonio Spurs fan 1 / 23 Back to Gallery Another round of leaked photos revealing ongoing renovations inside the AT&T Center have surfaced, giving Spurs fans a sneak-peek of what to expect from their game time experience this season.
Spurs super fan and Twitter persona, @TomTheSpursDude , shared never-before-seen photos of the AT&T Center with mySA.com.
The new pictures show new, high-definition screens being installed in sections 228, 203, 213 and 219, according to “Tom” who receives his information from an AT&T Center employee, he said.
RELATED: Leaked photos show San Antonio Spurs' new, huge scoreboard being installed at AT&T Center
The screens are one facet of the makeover totaling $111 million. Along with an upgraded viewing experience, stadium visitors will enjoy a new sound system, seating and amenities like bars and a dine-in Whataburger whenever they show up for an event.
Crews have been working non-stop since May to ready the arena for the Spurs’ season. The team’s first preseason game inside the AT&T Center tips off on Oct. 18 against the Detroit Pistons.
mmendoza@mysa.com
Twitter: @MaddySkye
